Descriptive Statistics

Source: R/descriptives.R
descriptives.Rd

Descriptive Statistics

descriptives(
  X,
  y,
  varnamesX = NULL,
  varnamey = NULL,
  plot = TRUE,
  msd = TRUE,
  cor = TRUE
)

Arguments

X

n by k numeric matrix. The data matrix \(\mathbf{X}\) (also known as design matrix, model matrix or regressor matrix) is an \(n \times k\) matrix of \(n\) observations of \(k\) regressors, which includes a regressor whose value is 1 for each observation on the first column.
y

Numeric vector of length n or n by 1 matrix. The vector \(\mathbf{y}\) is an \(n \times 1\) vector of observations on the regressand variable.
varnamesX

Character vector of length k. Variable names for matrix X.
varnamey

Character string. Variable name for vector y.
plot

Logical. Display scatter plot matrix.
msd

Logical. Print means and standard deviations.
cor

Logical. Print correlations.

Value

Returns descriptive statistics useful in k-variable linear regression model.

Examples

X <- jeksterslabRdatarepo::wages.matrix[["X"]]
y <- jeksterslabRdatarepo::wages.matrix[["y"]]
descriptives(
  X = X,
  y = y
)
#> 
#> Means and Standard Deviations:
#>                  Mean         SD
#> wages      12.3658495  7.8963503
#> gender      0.4972847  0.5001867
#> race        0.1528317  0.3599648
#> union       0.1590380  0.3658535
#> education  13.1450737  2.8138234
#> experience 18.7897595 11.6628366
#> age        37.9348332 11.4942777
#> 
#> Correlations:
#>                 wages      gender        race        union    education
#> wages       1.0000000 -0.22330183 -0.12783381  0.102246656  0.456517980
#> gender     -0.2233018  1.00000000  0.04327185 -0.088856935 -0.031439159
#> race       -0.1278338  0.04327185  1.00000000  0.080587911 -0.087061729
#> union       0.1022467 -0.08885694  0.08058791  1.000000000  0.003966952
#> education   0.4565180 -0.03143916 -0.08706173  0.003966952  1.000000000
#> experience  0.1731733 -0.02265681 -0.03912910  0.154319024 -0.180103012
#> age         0.2874694 -0.03068544 -0.06101581  0.157553168  0.062057953
#>             experience         age
#> wages       0.17317330  0.28746938
#> gender     -0.02265681 -0.03068544
#> race       -0.03912910 -0.06101581
#> union       0.15431902  0.15755317
#> education  -0.18010301  0.06205795
#> experience  1.00000000  0.97057500
#> age         0.97057500  1.00000000
